quotes: the Commission of Eminent Persons on The Role of the IAEA to 2020 and Beyond, whose report “Reinforcing the Global Nuclear Order for Peace and Prosperity” was launched in June 2008.
He had previously served as a member of the Carnegie Commission on Preventing Deadly Conflict, co-chaired by Cyrus Vance and David Hamburg (1994-97).
Gareth Evans has numerous awards and distinctions including the 2010 Franklin and Eleanor Roosevelt Institute/Roosevelt Stichting Four Freedoms Award for Freedom from Fear,
He was Australian Humanist of the Year in 1990,
won the ANZAC Peace Prize in 1994 for his work on Cambodia,
made an Officer of the Order of Australia (AO) in 2001.
The Chilean Order of Merit (Grand Cross), given in 1999 primarily for his work in initiating APEC
the 1995 Grawemeyer Prize for Ideas Improving World Order for his Foreign Policy article “Cooperative Security and Intrastate Conflict”.
Until 2020, Professor the Hon Gareth Evans AO QC was Chancellor of the Australian National University.
Gareth Evans has been a Member of the Global Leadership Foundation since 2010.
